info.title: UPS Accounts API
info.description: UPS Open Account API enables UPS 3rd Party Vendors to request a UPS Shipper Account. If the UPS Shipper Account request is approved, an UPS Shipper Account Number is generated. The UPS Ready Vendor user should first complete the registration process and get a My UPS ID before requesting a Shipper Account. Addresses are validated for accuracy. The User is expected to provide the primary reason for requesting a Shipper Account and the estimated number of Packages to be shipped.

requestBody.description: Generate sample code for popular API requests by selecting an example below. To view a full sample request and response, first click "Authorize" and enter your application credentials, then populate the required parameters above and click "Try it out".

oauth2.description:
Find your client_id and client_secret on your app info page.
1. Once your credentials are entered select \"Authorize\" and a bearer token will be generated.
2. Click \"Try it out\" and enter any required values.
3. Select an example request to use or provide your own.
4. Select \"Send the request using the values above\" to execute your API request.

endUserInformation.title: endUserInformation
endUserInformation.description: UPS Common Data Model for End User Information

deviceIdentity.description:
Provide the end user “IOBB” or blackbox information obtained via the iOvations Snare.js. To capture this information your application must integrate the ReputationManager 360 functionality. Guides to assist you with the integration are provided in the developer kit under the "ReputationManagerTM 360" folder.

Required if Billing Country code is European.

ipAddress.description: Allows the user to provide their IP address for the shipper account

taxId.description: Tax Id or EID for the Shipper Account

VAT.description: Optional and only applicable to European customers.

creditCardToken.description: Required if Customer Classification is of type "personal"
